result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* Per Order signed 09/21/22 - 18 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

22CF722, 22CF870 and 22CM173 are dismissed and read in as part of the agreement.
Concurrent with: 22CF264, 22CF513 & 22CF678

records.addlTxt:
Order for Jail Credit.
It is hereby ordered that the judgments of conviction in the above-captioned cases be amended to state that the defendant is entitled in 22CF264 to 17 days of jail credit, in 22CF339 to 18 days of jail credit, in 22CF513 to 17 days of jail credit, and in 22CF678 to 17 days of jail credit.
Proposed Order (on Stipulation for Jail Credit)
Stipulation for Jail Credit
Same as Complaint.

2:24 PM Cases called: 22CF264, 22CF339, 22CF513, 22CF678, 22CF722, 22CF870 and 22CM173. Defendant Michael L. White in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Michael L. White.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing in 22CF870 & 22CF722. All other cases are riding along for today's purposes. 

Defendant would like to waive right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in each of the felony files. All of the Informations that will be filed, will either mirror the criminal complaint or mirror the agreement.  Defendant will file the Informations within 24 hours. The Defendant will have the following 24 hours to object to the filings.

There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  
Defendant enters a no contest plea to the following counts:
Count 1 in 22CF264: Felony Retail Theft
Count 1 in 22CF339: Retail Theft
Count 4 in 22CF513: Retail Theft 
Count 1 in 22CF678: Bail Jumping Felony
Count 7 in 22CF678: Felony Retail Theft

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: 3 years Probation sentence withheld on each count concurrent. 

Conditions of Probation:
Restitution to be determined within 30 days. Defendant to make monthly payments of at least $100 until restitution is paid in full. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. To be completed within 6 months of plea date.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/controlled substances.
No contact with Kwik Trip locations, Festival Food locations, Woodmans locations, Target locations, Best Buy locations or Ace Hardware locations.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
5 sets of court costs and surcharges. 

Parties will file a stipulation with the court as to jail credit. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in, Including all of 22CF722, 22CF870 and 22CM173.
